TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The Temporary "First Contract Edition" Thread

Articles.Content: Will we have to purchase another copy in order to get 64-bit on Windows? Can I obtain a Linux copy without purchasing another if I already own a Windows copy?

Will we have to purchase another copy in order to get 64-bit on Windows? Can I obtain a Linux copy without purchasing another if I already own a Windows copy?

If you bought through the KSP Store you have access to all versions already. Not sure about Steam.

If you bought through the KSP Store you have access to all versions already. Not sure about Steam.

You can download Steam versions on any type of computer it supports. I'm guessing the 64-bit will be a Steam beta version, sort-of like the last version of KSP is always available on Steam as a beta.

Could it be.. the Module-That-Must-Not-Be-Named problem has been.. dare I say it, solved?
Will the x64 be just the same thing found in the forum thread (released as-is), or will it be tested and at least somewhat debugged before release?

Could it be.. the Module-That-Must-Not-Be-Named problem has been.. dare I say it, solved?

We asked about this a patch or two ago, and we'd hoped that the solution would involve automatic dependency resolution. The solution Mu implemented will resolve dependency load order, but it requires you to manually declare your dependencies and add an attribute to assemblies that are referenced. (Note that this can't be done with third-party dependencies.) It also adds versioning on top, which I think has hurt adoption of the system. The .NET framework already has an assembly naming, versioning and dependency resolution system, so I'm not sure why Mu went with the manual approach. I'm interested in this situation being improved, but as far as I know, nobody's asked for it in 0.24. There are a few other plugin loading issues that I'm told have been fixed, however.

Will the x64 be just the same thing found in the forum thread (released as-is), or will it be tested and at least somewhat debugged before release?

I think it will probably be a lot more stable than the one on the forum.
So...what is meant by restructuring of KSP-TV?

0.24? 64 bit? Experimentals?

Woohoo!

Yes! Super excited for this update, I've haven't been playing KSP much recently because I was waiting for the update to start a new career. This will be really fun! 64 bits, new aesthetic improvements, modders' requests, contracts, more polished UI -- this will be great. Even though KSP has been my favorite game, of uh, all time, since 0.18, seeing it go through development and becoming even awesome-er is a dream come true for both me and obviously the KSP development team.

Edited June 25, 2014 by Woopert

Actually yeah any word on 64-bit and steam users?

The terms under which I bought KSP state that I am entitled to all future updates that are released for the game (that aren't expansions or sequels). If 0.24, an update, contains a 64-bit version for Windows, my interpretation is that I am entitled to receive a copy of it for free. So, regardless of whether or not Steam supports 64-bit games natively (though I'm pretty certain it does; the *client* is 32-bit, but it definitely should support 64-bit games), Squad needs to provide a way for me to access the x64 version. I know the terms seem to be most often used here to explain why Squad doesn't have to release any sort of updates ever, nor interact with the community to any degree, nor give me all expansions and sequels for free, but there are things that I *am* entitled to: Squad can't release x64 for Windows without somehow giving me (and other Steam users) a copy.

Edited June 25, 2014 by cpast
